class Actions.NetworkActions.Diagnostics.diagnostics_actions.DiagActions[source]¶

Bases: object

Diagnostics keyword class

ping_from_remotehost(system_name, session_name=None, dest_system=None, ip_type='ip', count='5')[source]¶

This keyword will use connection session available in source system (provided in system name) and will ping from source system to destination system

Datafile usuage:
 

Tags or attributes to be used in input datafile for the system or subsystem.If both tag and attribute is provided the attribute will be used. 1. prompt = prompt of the source system 2. ip = ipv4 address or defaulted to lcn ip 3. ipv6 = ipv6 address or defaulted to lcn ipv6 4. dns = dns name 5. lmp_ip = ipv4 address of lmp port of dut 6. lmp_ipv6 = ipv6 address of lmp port of dut note: one of <ip>,<ipv6>,<dns>,<lmp_ip>,<lmp_ipv6> tags specified in

ip_type argument is sufficient to be present in inputdatafile
Arguments:
  1. system_name(string) = name of the Linux machine on which to execute
  2. session_name(string) = name of the session
  3. dest_system(string) = names of the destination system
  4. ip_type(string) = iptype of the dest system through which it needs to be connected.
    needs to be one of (ip/ipv4/dns/lmp_ip/lmp_ipv6).It has to be present in the input data file.
  5. count(string) = count argument to be supplied to the ping
Returns:
  1. bool (True/False)
traceroute_from_remotehost(system_name, session_name=None, dest_system=None, ip_type='ip')[source]¶

This keyword will use connection session available in source system (provided in system name) and will execute traceroute from source system to destination system

Datafile usuage:
 

Tags or attributes to be used in input datafile for the system or subsystem.If both tag and attribute is provided the attribute will be used. 1. prompt = prompt of the source system 2. ip = ipv4 address or defaulted to lcn ip 3. ipv6 = ipv6 address or defaulted to lcn ipv6 4. dns = dns name 5. lmp_ip = ipv4 address of lmp port of dut 6. lmp_ipv6 = ipv6 address of lmp port of dut note: one of <ip>,<ipv6>,<dns>,<lmp_ip>,<lmp_ipv6> tags specified in

ip_type argument is sufficient to be present in inputdatafile
Arguments:
  1. system_name(string) = name of the Linux machine on which to execute
  2. session_name(string) = name of the session
  3. dest_system(string) = names of the destination system
  4. ip_type(string) = iptype of the dest system through which it needs to be connected.
    needs to be one of (ip/ipv4/dns/lmp_ip/lmp_ipv6).It has to be present in the input data file.
Returns:
  1. bool (True/False)
